link.title: High Plains » COVID-19 Comments Feed
Milling work will begin on Road C as early as the week of March 9th.

body.class: post-template-default single single-post postid-923 single-format-standard group-blog

div.class: post-923 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-main-page category-uncategorized

div.p: In coordination with DHHS, Four Corners Health and Nebraska Department of Education, our district is monitoring the developing information related to the spread of COVID-19 (commonly referred to as the coronavirus). This is an unprecedented situation and remains extremely fluid. Should this situation interfere with the district’s ordinary operations or schedule, you will be provided notice in the customary fashion.

We encourage you to remain informed about the spread of the coronavirus, and would recommend that you visit the website for the Department of Health and Human Services, found here, for further information as it develops. Our community message is that people need to stay home when they are sick, practice good handwashing and do not touch your hands to your face. We strongly recommend any individuals who have underlying health issues, to be in contact with your health provider.
Please rest assured that the High Plains Community District is monitoring the situation and is prepared to take necessary steps should the situation arise!
